evp	fall	noun	3	B2	when someone or something falls down to the ground, often without intending to or by accident	He had a nasty fall and hurt his back.	I was terrified and I heard the noise of a fall just by my side.
evp	fall	noun	4	C1	when a city, government, leader, etc. loses power or control	the fall of the Roman Empire	After the fall of the previous system everything changed.

evp	intellectual	adjective	1	B2	relating to your ability to think and to understand things, especially complicated ideas	intellectual and physical development	First of all, I don't think your programme needs any improvement: in my opinion, your selection of films is already very satisfying because it includes both spectacular Hollywood movies and intellectual films.
evp	intellectual	adjective	2	C2	interested in learning and in thinking about complicated ideas	She's very intellectual.	He made a good impression on her from the beginning, dressed in a dark blue evening suit, with a patterned bow tie, glimmering leather shoes and flashing spectacles that made him look very intellectual.
evp	intellectual	noun	1	C2	someone who enjoys studying and thinking about complicated ideas	She was a real intellectual.	As an intellectual and thinker (the glasses Piggy wears stand for these attributes), he is admired by Ralph, the chief.

Some people complain that they do not have enough time to develop intellectually when they are in their 20s or 30s because they have to take care of their small children.

evp	position	noun	7	C1	to be able to do something because of your situation	I'm not in a position to talk about this at the moment.	But no one is in a position to know about it yet, since now it is just an option.

evp	yet	adverb	2	A2	now or as early as this time	I don't want to go home yet.	I don't need it yet because my parents gave me a new computer for my birthday.
evp	yet	adverb	3	B2	the best or worst, etc. until now	Of all the songs I've heard tonight, that's the best yet.	And that was my worst experience yet.
evp	yet	adverb	4	C1	again after something has happened or been done many times before	The bus was late yet again.	It's another new year and yet again the early year quietness is present... until I got these two games, Quake 3 Arena (Q3A for short) and Unreal To[u]rnament (UT for short).
evp	yet	adverb	5	C1	from now and for a particular period of time in the future	She won't be back for a long time yet.	It's a fact that everybody knows that living in Poland is not easy now and it won't be for a long time yet.
evp	yet	adverb	6	C1	until and including this time	I haven't heard as yet if their flight has arrived.	I would like to do something about it, but as I can't imagine building anything near my beautiful house (because I'm afraid it would destroy its wonderful harmony), I have no idea as yet how to solve this problem.
evp	yet	adverb	7	C2	used to show that you are surprised or annoyed that something is being repeated or increased	He's given us yet more work to do.	The awe-inspiring view of the park must not be destroyed for yet another building.
evp	yet	adverb	8	C2	used to say there is still a possibility that something will happen	He may win yet.	Weakened, the tunnel could yet crumble and fall at any time.
evp	yet	adverb	9	C2	to not have done something that was expected before this time	They have yet to make a decision.	But she had yet to inform her fianc√©.

evp	yield	verb	2	C2	to produce or provide something	to yield a profit	It is to be hoped that my suggestion will be implemented and will yield immediate results.

Like many other nations worldwide, with mastering much more knowledge and skills of information technology than the elder group of people, it is not surprising that Chinese youngsters learn more than their previous generations did about what is happening around the world.

evp	youth	noun	2	B2	the period of time when someone is young	I was a fairly good football player in my youth.	I played several kinds of sports during my youth, but now I am not a member of any club.
